title: Cais de S. Jorge
body:
The construction of this pier began in 1904 and was completed in 1910. It was the Junta Geral (General Assembly) that ordered its execution.

Cais da Pedra da Pescaria, in Faial. It was built by the same corporation from 1903 to 1905. (See Cacongo).

Cais do Porto da Cruz. It was built by the Junta Geral in 1903.

Cais do Ilhéu de Cima, in Porto Santo. It was built in 1902 and is intended for the service of the lighthouse employees.

Pier in the Island of Porto Santo. The neighboring island of Porto Santo is now served by a pontoon, which provides excellent service to the movement of that port, and we will discuss it further. (See Island of Porto Santo).

In ancient times, there was a plan to build a pier in front of the Funchal Customs House, and in 1824, Brigadier Raposo and Major Sant’Ana came to Madeira to choose a location for the construction of a pier and a wharf. The chosen location was the lowlands of S. Tiago, but despite the significant amount of 37 contos spent on the acquisition and preparation of materials for the works, they were never started.
